newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht up, interbank rate falls late.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht up, interbank rate falls late.

text.p: The baht firmed slightly against the dollar in late trade on Wednesday after earlier active dollar buying eased, dealers said.
"Dollar buying was quite strong today. But dollar's decline against major currencies in the afternoon dried up its buying," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
The baht firmed to 26.075/26.080 to the dollar late from 26.079/26.084 in the morning, dealers said.
The central bank fixed the baht/dollar mid-rate at 26.06 against 26.10 on Tuesday.

The overnight interbank rate eased further to 8.75-9.00 percent in late trade from 9.00-9.50 earlier as banks continued lending funds to the market after a bank reserve deadline on Wednesday, dealers said.
"Strong dollar buying today kept interbank rates from sharp falls. But liquidity will likely rise further later this week," said a money market dealer.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium stayed unchanged at 5.50/6.00 satangs per dollar in late trade.
